text: fyi, if anyone is interested in Julia + Static typing, feel free to joing the zulip thread <https://julialang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/137791-general/topic/Static.20typing.20.2F.20static.20analysis.20for.20Julia|here> , prompted by this discourse <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/are-there-julia-operational-semantics-available/52923/4|post>

attachments.title: JuliaLang
attachments.text: This is the Zulip server for the Julia programming language community. We ask anyone joining to adhere to the Julia Code of Conduct. | To learn more about Julia, check out <https://julialang.org/>, or just come ask us here! | You can reach out to the admins of this Zulip by sending a direct message to @zulip-admins.

attachments.title: Are there Julia operational semantics available?
attachments.text: Thanks @thautwarm @StefanKarpinski. I’ll start working on my thesis in the next months. The background idea is to implement an effect system for a functional programming language, similar to Koka. Koka’s formalization helped with extensive static analysis to generate code that does not need garbage collection at runtime. I liked Julia’s LISP-like metaprogramming features a lot, something which OCaml (the other candidate lang for my work) sort of lacks. Metaprogramming simply makes the job eas...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Are there Julia operational semantics available?
